command: [withheld] PowerShell starting cscript.exe to run a Microsoft-signed JS/VBS helper that unexpectedly launches a non-related executable (details redacted).
explanation: This captures the broader T1216 behavior where cscript.exe executes a trusted script that is misused to proxy execution of another binary, leveraging the signed script’s trust to evade controls.
rationale_steps: powershell.exe -> cscript.exe lineage with a system-signed script as the target.
Inconsistent or malformed parameters passed to the signed script.
Observation of secondary process creation unrelated to the script’s documented purpose.
No corroborating system configuration changes or expected events follow.
User context and timing do not align with legitimate administrative activity.
